(very quiet) Right...
Okay, great!  So let's reset! Crew members start moving things around. In the audience, Michael locks eyes with Andy.  An odd, knowing moment between the brothers.  Michael whispers, getting worried.
Andy...!
Stanley and Janice feel as if the commercials are lasting forever.
Why is Andy doing this?  Why?... Why? The Fridays JINGLE starts, and Andy's face fades in on th TV.  He looks directly into the camera, nervous, stiff an serious.
During the commercial, the people at ABC asked me to apologize... and to tell you the truth.  They wanted me to explain that this whole fighting episode was staged...
The sign above blinks "APPLAUSE".  The audience obedientl APPLAUDS.  In the booth, Maynard grins.

And... um... (choking up) I can't do this. (beat) I-I can't say it. (upset) It's a lie!  A cover-up! Maynard is suddenly very confused.  The crowd laughs nervously. ANDY (cont'd) Why are you laughing?  I'm not trying to be funny!  They threatened to fire me from Taxi, unless I gave in to their demands! (shaken) But... I won't!  Because what you saw was REAL!!
Maynard looks like he's gonna faint.
Cue the commercial!

These kinds of things go on everyday at the networks, only you never see it, because they cut to commercials. (he talks extremely fast, to get in as much information before he's cut off) Now for sure they're gonna fire me, so if you want to see me again, you'll have to come to Memphis... And BLINK!  Andy gets CUT OFF. Maynard jumps up, furious.  He snaps.
I'm gonna STRANGLE George Shapiro!
The parents stare at the commercials.  They're totally disoriented.
What's in Memphis?
Who knows?!  That kid is totally meshuga.
Memphis wrestling.  The announcer stands center ring, booming into the mike.

And now!  The MAIN EVENT of the evening!  The match you've been waiting for: The King Jerry Lawler, versus Hollywood Andy Kaufman! The THEME FROM "ROCKY" PLAYS -- and Lawler enters from th tunnel, wearing a shimmering hero's cape!  The crowd ROAR with approval.
Andy is meditating, eyes shut, at rest in his private oas Suddenly -- DESPERATE BANGING on the door.
C'MON, KAUFMAN!  Christ, you're ON! Andy awakens.  He smiles.

The THEME FROM "MIGHTY MOUSE" begins playing.  Then, ANDY strides in, a sneer on his grungy face.  The crowd SCREAM and BOOS pure pile.  Andy is euphoric, loving the hatred. Down in the front row sit Stanley, Janice, Zmuda, and Lyn Several PHOTOGRAPHERS take pictures of the parents.  They squint, unused to all this. Andy prances into the ring.  He takes the mike.

Before we begin this event, I just wanna say a few things to you foul people. (beat) This city is filthy!  You Southerners live like pigs!  So I'm going to teach you some lessons in hygiene... bring you out of your squalor. Holy cow.  The crowd is flabbergasted.  Women in K-mart dresses gape.  Ruddy men in trucker caps glare. ANDY (cont'd) Are you listening? (audience BOOS)
Lynne snickers.  But Stanley and Janice are ashen-faced.
Why is he saying these things?!
They're gonna lynch him!
(he shakes his head) Nah.  He's just engaging a passive audience. Andy reaches in his pocket and removes... a bar of SOAP.

People, this is a bar of soap.  Does it look familiar to you?  If you wet it, it'll clean your hands. Stanley's eyes bulge. The crowd is enraged -- rumblings of imminent violence. Andy smiles helpfully. ANDY (cont'd) And now, for your next lesson: This -- is toilet paper. Andy holds up a ROLL OF TISSUE. That's it.  The crowd goes NUTS.  Jerry Lawler races over and snatches the mike, trying to maintain his dignity.
Kaufman, we've had enough!!  Let's you and me do what we came here for

And DING!  That's the bell!  Andy strikes a threatening pose.  Lawler takes a step forward -- and Andy instantly, cowardly, runs for the ropes and jumps out of the ring. BOOOOO!!!  Andy grins at the crowd and points at his brai I'm smarter.
And Kaufman's left the ring! Lawler's waiting for him to return.

(to Zmuda) Is this a strategy? Lawler disparagingly frowns.  The REF checks his watch. Andy crosses to the opposite end of the ring, gauging his rival... then slowly climbs in -- Until the second Lawler moves.  Then Andy leaps back out!

And Kaufman's left the ring again! He doesn't seem interested in actually making contact with his opponent. Andy struts around the floor, pointing to his brain.  He smirks at various spectators... until he finds himself fa to-face with -- his parents. An unexpected moment.  Andy's finger frozen on his brain. Janice shakes her head despairingly.
Andy, please.  Let's go home! Cameras FLASH.  The paparazzi love these moments.
Don't worry, Mom.  I'll make you proud...! Beat -- then Andy gets HIT in the head with a cup. People HOOT.  Disoriented, Andy returns to the ringside. Lawler is losing his patience.

Hey!  Did you come down here to wrestle, or to act like an ass? Andy paces around, unsure of his next move. LAWLER (cont'd) Look... if you get in here, I'll give you a free headlock. Lawler leans down and offers his neck. Andy peers skeptically.  People JEER.  Andy looks at wait Lawler... then tentatively climbs in. As promised, Lawler doesn't move.  So Andy crosses over a grabs Lawler's head!  Andy grins triumphantly.  He squeez his arms tight, muscles flexing, riding high on this mome Until -- Lawler stands and flips him over.  Andy SLAMS DO on his back.  CRUNCH!
It's a side suplex!! Andy lies on the mat, unmoving.  Lawler doesn't care.  He picks up Andy's prone body and grips it upside-down.  Jan covers her eyes.  Stanley is worried.
(frantically gesturing)
Lawler disregards the Ref and slams Andy's head in a pile driver!! A horrible THUD. DING!  The BELL immediately RINGS. JANICE opens her eyes and SCREAMS.
Why isn't he MOVING?? Andy's parents' reaction is a fiesta for photographers.

Lawler has committed a PILEDRIVER, which is an AUTOMATIC DISQUALIFICATION!  Match goes to Kaufman by disqualification, after two minutes, twelve seconds! Andy is splayed unconscious. Raging Lawler promenades around the ring, arms over his head.  The crowd SHOUTS CRAZILY, rooting him on. Lynne runs to the ropes, SCREAMING for help.
(frantic) Somebody get a DOCTOR!
(yelling)

Stanley, totally numbed, holds Janice.  They're on the ve of collapsing.  Tons of commotion.  Cameras FLASH BLINDINGLY.  A stretcher is lifted into the ring.  Andy i loaded on.  MUSIC fights the deafening NOISE. BEDLAM.  Andy is carried through the crowd, followed by h entourage.  A soft object HITS Stanley on the head.
Andy is being carried by the Coliseum EMPLOYEES into the dressing room.  The entourage follows.  Zmuda pushes out crowd of REPORTERS, PHOTOGRAPHERS, and ONLOOKERS.  He sla the door and locks it.
Janice runs to Andy's side.  She's crying.
Andy!!  Are you okay?!? Andy opens his eyes.
I'm fine, Mom, you can calm down. A confused beat.
B-but... we saw... your neck...

Nah, it's phony baloney -- I faked the whole thing. (beat) It didn't hurt at all.  It was just a yoga move.  I tucked my head in. Deadpan, Andy sits up. Total silence.  Stanley stares... then a FURY comes over him.

Andrew -- HOW DARE YOU!!  For all we knew, you were DYING!  Look at your mother -- she's still shaking! Andy is splayed unconscious. Raging Lawler promenades around the ring, arms over his head.  The crowd SHOUTS CRAZILY, rooting him on. Lynne runs to the ropes, SCREAMING for help.
(frantic) Somebody get a DOCTOR!
(yelling)

Stanley, totally numbed, holds Janice.  They're on the ve of collapsing.  Tons of commotion.  Cameras FLASH BLINDINGLY.  A stretcher is lifted into the ring.  Andy i loaded on.  MUSIC fights the deafening NOISE. BEDLAM.  Andy is carried through the crowd, followed by h entourage.  A soft object HITS Stanley on the head.
Andy is being carried by the Coliseum EMPLOYEES into the dressing room.  The entourage follows.  Zmuda pushes out crowd of REPORTERS, PHOTOGRAPHERS, and ONLOOKERS.  He sla the door and locks it.
Janice runs to Andy's side.  She's crying.
Andy!!  Are you okay?!? Andy opens his eyes.
I'm fine, Mom, you can calm down. A confused beat.
B-but... we saw... your neck...

Nah, it's phony baloney -- I faked the whole thing. (beat) It didn't hurt at all.  It was just a yoga move.  I tucked my head in. Deadpan, Andy sits up. Total silence.  Stanley stares... then a FURY comes over him.
Andrew -- HOW DARE YOU!!  For all we knew, you were DYING!  Look at your mother -- she's still shaking!

But that's it.  I needed you to believe!  Our family will be in the newspapers.  People will look, and they'll be touched.  Because your emotions were honest! Stanley has a blank expression.  But Janice starts to cry
Andy, I love you!  I love you, whatever you do...! She hugs Andy tightly. Andy is genuinely shocked.  He looks at his quivering mother... and then his voice softens, truly remorseful.
Geez, I'm sorry.  Maybe I shouldn't have put you through all that... (quiet) Well, from now on, you'll always know the rule of thumb: Anything that happens to me... IS NOT REAL.

A crowd of reporters parts.  They make way for Andy, who carried out on the stretcher and loaded into a waiting AMBULANCE.  He is "unconscious." Cameras CLICK and FLASH.  The ambulance speeds away, sire WAILING.
Andy sits watching an OLD DOCTOR examining a number of x- rays clipped to light panels.
I don't see any injury to your neck, Mr. Kaufman.
Are you sure?
Positive.
But my neck hurts... and I have a slight cough...
It's probably just a strained muscle.
(intent) Doctor, I think I need a neck brace. The Doctor gives up.
If it makes you happy...
Andy in the ring, Andy outside the ring, on the floor, wi his frightened parents, in a neck brace, on the stretcher etc.
George, Zmuda and Andy are looking through hundreds of clippings from the newspapers.

(reading aloud) "... has been rushed to a nearby hospital, where doctors are checking him for possible paralysis.  His parents are at his bedside.  Fans will best remember Kaufman as lovable Latka on television's Taxi"...
It's a rave!  Boy, if I ever fake my death, they'll really miss me.
It's working for Elvis.
(sarcastic) Yeah, he's just laying low, waitin' for his comeback. (he sees an article and winces) God, listen to this!  "It was morally wrong to take advantage of such an unstable individual..."
Wow, you can't BUY this kind of publicity! George rolls his eyes.

George, let's not drop the ball on this.  I've made some kind of cosmic career move. Somebody KNOCKS outside.  Andy jumps up, puts on his neck brace, and transforms himself into a shuffling invalid. DELIVERY BOY drags in an enormous basket of flowers and goodies.  Andy takes the card.  It reads "Andy, we're all praying for you.  Your friends at Taxi." Andy chuckles.
George is eating with the Saturday Night Live Producer, Lorne Michaels.  They're eating lunch in an outdoor cafe.

Thanks for seeing me on such short notice. (he takes a careful beat) I... I wanted to talk to you about booking Andy on "Saturday Night Live." Lorne Michaels squirms uncomfortably.  He chooses his wor
George -- I don't know if Andy works for our show anymore.  That wrestling stuff... is such a turnoff.

We agree completely. (tactfully begging) Andy has to reconnect with his core audience.  So I got him on Letterman tonight.  He's gonna apologize to Jerry Lawler, then repent for all his bad guy shenanigans. Lorne Michaels mulls this over.
That's smart.
He's very sincere. (quietly emphatic) And he needs your show... Beat.  Lorne Michaels nods.
Okay.  It'd be good to have the old Andy back.

Andy and Jerry Lawler are on DAVID LETTERMAN'S show.  And is pallid, hair shaggy, in a neckbrace and tweed jacket. Husky Lawler wears loud red pants and gold chains. Andy speaks timidly, seeming a bit dazed and regretful.

I apologize for all the wrestling I've ever done.  I'm sorry for all the abuse I've ever given... (soft) I was just playing bad guy wrestler. That's not me... it's just a role. But Jerry took it personally. Lawler and Letterman are unimpressed.
You said some pretty inflammatory things.
He thinks everything's a joke -- but it's not. (to Andy) Did you laugh when you were layin' in the hospital?? The crowd WHOOOOS. Angst flickers on Andy's sweaty face.  He stammers.
T-there wasn't a reason to purposely hurt me --
You're a wimp.
(upset) My father said I should've gotten a lawyer --!
Then your father's a wimp.
(losing it) And you're just poor white trash! Lawler's had enough.  Enraged, he wildly stands and SLAPS Andy.

Andy crashes over and falls from his chair. THUD.  He's on the floor. Dead silence.  Everyone is astonished. They're all slack-jawed.  Even PAUL SHAFFER.  Trying to cover, Paul hurriedly kicks in with a ROCKABILLY TUNE. Andy jumps up, crazed. ANDY (cont'd)

head_text.subj: I'M SICK AND TIRED OF THIS SHIT

text: Lawler freezes in his seat.  Letterman hides behind his desk. Andy storms over, out-of-control.  From a safe distance, starts SCREAMING at Lawler. ANDY (cont'd) YOU ARE FULL OF SHIT, Lawler!  I
(he POUNDS the desk)
Freaked, Andy leaps up and storms out.
You said some pretty inflammatory things.
He thinks everything's a joke -- but it's not. (to Andy) Did you laugh when you were layin' in the hospital?? The crowd WHOOOOS. Angst flickers on Andy's sweaty face.  He stammers.
T-there wasn't a reason to purposely hurt me --
You're a wimp.
(upset) My father said I should've gotten a lawyer --!
Then your father's a wimp.
(losing it) And you're just poor white trash! Lawler's had enough.  Enraged, he wildly stands and SLAPS Andy.

Andy crashes over and falls from his chair. THUD.  He's on the floor. Dead silence.  Everyone is astonished. They're all slack-jawed.  Even PAUL SHAFFER.  Trying to cover, Paul hurriedly kicks in with a ROCKABILLY TUNE. Andy jumps up, crazed. ANDY (cont'd)

head_text.subj: I'M SICK AND TIRED OF THIS SHIT

text: Lawler freezes in his seat.  Letterman hides behind his desk. Andy storms over, out-of-control.  From a safe distance, starts SCREAMING at Lawler. ANDY (cont'd) YOU ARE FULL OF SHIT, Lawler!  I
(he POUNDS the desk)

Freaked, Andy leaps up and storms out. The crowd CHEERS rowdily. An unsure moment.  Dave glances at Lawler. Until, Andy stumbles back in.  He tries to calm himself. ANDY (cont'd) I am sorry.  I am sorry to use those words on television.  I apologize! I'm sorry! (demented) But YOU -- you're a MOTHERFUCKING

Andy slams Dave's desk.  Dave jerks nervously. Crazed, Andy looks down at Dave's coffee cup.  Uh-oh. Suddenly, Andy grabs the coffee and DUMPS it on Lawler! Lawler jumps, burned.  A SECURITY GUARD runs in. Andy screams and hurtles away.  He slams open the stage d and barrels out of sight.
Lorne Michaels is watching this at home.  He gapes in disbelief.
Jesus Christ.
A SMUG COMIC stands on stage, speaking into camera.  The show's going out live.

Hi.  Um, we were supposed to have Andy Kaufman on our show this week - - but now our producers aren't sure if it's such a good idea. (beat) Some of us at Saturday Night Live think Kaufman's a comic genius.  But others disagree... they say he's just not funny anymore. (beat) So we're putting the decision up to you.  Please call up and vote.  To keep Andy, call 1-900-244-7618.  To DUMP him, call...
Tight on Andy, staring at the LA Times.  A small headline says "JOKESTER ANDY KAUFMAN VOTED OFF 'SATURDAY NIGHT LIV He is bothered.
This is bad... I only got 28 percent!  I'm like McGovern in '72... George sighs.

And this wasn't "Merv."  This was the hippest audience on television. (grim) They've turned on you. At that... we reveal that SOMEONE ELSE is sitting next to Andy.  But only the back of his head is visible. GEORGE (cont'd) It's like you two guys wanted to destroy Andy's career!  Upsetting all those people... putting out that toxic venom... (helpless) What did you THINK would happen?!
(guilty) We were just trying to push the envelope --

You're BLIND!  There is no envelope anymore!! (beat) It hurts me to say this... but there's only one solution -- (pained) I don't want you two to ever work together again. We WIDEN... And the other person is JERRY LAWLER.  He feels bad.
I'm sorry.  We thought it was funny...
Jer', it's not your fault.  You were terrific. (sad) But maybe George is right...
That's fine.  But I wouldn't have traded it for anything... (poignant) Because for one brief, shining moment... the world thought that wrestling was real. Andy gulps emotionally.
We'll stay in touch.  Next time I'm in Memphis, I'll stop by the house, and Noreen can make me her double chocolate cake.
Alright, buddy... (choked up) Stay good. Andy and Jerry hug. A touching beat... until Andy gets a Quixotic gleam.
Maybe I can turn it into a bit.  I can go back on the show, and say it was rigged.  Demand a recount...
Andy!  You don't get it! (somber) They don't want you back. Andy's face drops.
The Yogi slowly walks down the corridor, deep in thought. few DISCIPLES IN TURBANS mill around.
NINE STUDENTS, sitting in the Lotus position, are listeni to a teacher.  The teacher is Andy.

Open your eyes... close your eyes... open your eyes... close your eyes... open your eyes... close your eyes... Andy is repeating this faster and faster; the students ar blinking their eyes faster and faster. The door opens.  The Yogi sticks his head in.
Excuse me, Andy...
Yes, your Holiness? The Yogi signals Andy to step out of the room.
Andy steps out.
This is very difficult for me to say... but -- perhaps it would be best if you didn't attend the retreat.
(surprised) Why??  I... I attend every year.
Yes -- we do not doubt your devotion to TM.  But we feel that perhaps... you and the program have grown apart philosophically. Andy is stunned.
"Philosophically"?

(he sighs) The wrestling... the sexist remarks... the foul language... these things are not becoming of an enlightened individual. (beat) It seems you have no respect for anything. Andy is stupefied.  He doesn't know how to respond.
Of course I do... The Yogi shakes his head.  Andy can't believe it.  He loo around -- men in turbans staring at him. Andy cracks.
Please!  You've GOT to let me take the classes!  It's how I keep myself
It is apparently not working.
So HELP ME!  All I wanna do is

(pained) Andy, don't raise your voice.  We don't wish your presence here. Andy is broken. He fights to bottle his rage -- then notices Little Wendy down the corridor, peering helplessly.  Beaten, Andy wave goodbye to her. Little Wendy gulps, then waves goodbye too.

Middle of the afternoon, Andy lies in bed.  Covers pulled to his face, expression glum, he's like a tragic still-li Suddenly DING-DONG!  It's the doorbell. Andy ignores this.  Beat.  Another DING-DONG!  Then KNOCKING.
Go away.
It's me.
Oh, it's open. The door opens.  Lynne enters, holding a carton of ice cream.
I brought you Haagen Dazs. Chocolate.
(mournful) I don't deserve Haagen Daz.  I'm a horrible person.
Andy, you're not horrible.  You're just... complicated.
You don't know the real me.
Andy... there is no real you.
An astonished silence. And then... he slowly smiles.
You're probably right. They both giggle. Andy studies her... looking at Lynne's face, body, eyes. Pause.
Do you wanna move in together? Lynne smiles slyly.  She leans down and kisses him.
A moving van outside a funky 60's house.  MOVERS carry bo in.

Andy sits disoriented in the living room.  Movers bustle around him.  Mirrors get leaned against opposing walls -- and he finds himself looking into multiple reflections of himself. In the b.g., Lynne arranges some vases, then hurries out. Andy opens a box and pulls out his old Howdy Doody doll. smiles, then places Howdy on the shelf next to the vases. Suddenly a phone on the floor RINGS.  He grins.
Hey!  Our first phone call! (he scrambles for the phone) Hello?
Andy... it's me.  I've got some crummy news. (long beat) Taxi's been canceled. Silence. Andy has no response. GEORGE (V.O.) (cont'd) Do you want me to come over?  Talk about it?

Um... no.  Uh, I'm sorta busy right now.  Thanks.  We'll get together next week. Andy hangs up.  He just sits there... confused... unsure to react. Andy scratches his head -- then feels something odd.  He goes over to the mirror.  On the back of his neck... is a inflamed red pimple.  Andy grimaces. ANDY (cont'd) Yuck!

Very late -- a clock says 1:15.  A YOUNG COMIC is onstage performing to the DOZEN audience members left. In back walks... Andy.  Unshaven, morose, he quietly approaches paternal owner BUDD FRIEDMAN.  Budd sees him, grins, and gives him a hearty hug.  Andy points at the st and asks for something -- Budd eagerly nods.
Budd is onstage.
And now we have a treat for you late- night diehards.  The star of Taxi -- here in person, Andy Kaufman! The sparse crowd APPLAUDS.  Budd leaves, and Andy shuffle up.

Actually, Budd, you're wrong.  I found out today that Taxi's been canceled. The crowd AWWWWS sadly.  Andy blinks. ANDY (cont'd) Yeah, that's how I felt too... though I don't know why.  'Cause for years, all I wanted to do was get off that show. (quiet, very confessional) But now that nobody will hire me, and nobody thinks I'm funny... I guess it was probably a pretty good job. One guy LAUGHS sharply. Andy gives him a look -- thinks -- then continues. ANDY (cont'd) Not to mention that my wife has left me.  And she took the kids. (he sighs) I don't know what I'm gonna do with myself.  My options are sorta limited... (beat) This morning, I noticed I've got a cyst, or some kind of boil, on the back of my neck.  It's really disgusting.  Look. Andy turns.  The red lump is bigger, grosser.  The crowd GROANS, revolted. ANDY (cont'd) So I was thinking, since I'm sort of a quasi-celebrity, that I could charge people to touch it. (candid) Does anybody want to pay a buck to touch my cyst? A couple stoners GIGGLE and CLAP.  Andy COUGHS, then frow ANDY (cont'd) I'm serious. A pause... then a few curious people walk up to the stage The first taker is a GOOFY BLONDE WOMAN.  She starts to reach for the cyst -- when Andy stops her. ANDY (cont'd) No, no, you gotta pay first. She nods, discomforted, and reaches for her purse...
A BUSBOY sweeps up.  Budd counts money in the cash regist Andy shuffles out of the showroom.  He waves some bills.
I made six bucks.  That's good money. Budd stares sadly.

This is a comedy club -- not a medical sideshow. (trying to be kind) If you wanna perform here, take a shower, get some sleep, and pull yourself together.  Come back and do the material that people love: Do the Mighty Mouse, the Foreign guy! Andy, you gotta snap out of this funk!  If you can -- I'll give you the headline spot tomorrow. Andy thinks.  The wheels are spinning.
George is driving down Melrose, listening to the radio. glances at the passing marquee -- then does a doubletake. It says "ANDY KAUFMAN - 9 P.M."
Puzzled George hurries inside.  COMICS greet him: "Hey George!"  "George, you got a second?!"  George distracted waves and moves through.  At the showroom door, he finds Budd.
Hey, what's going on here?
George, you won't believe it... I got Andy to do all the old material! (grinning) And he's killin' them! Inside, there's HUGE LAUGHTER.  George's eyes widen. Piqued, he goes in...
And it's packed!  Andy is onstage, playing struggling, lovable Foreign Man.

... but one ting I do not like is too much traffic.  Tonight I had to come on de freeway, and it was so much traffic... (giggling) It took me an hour and a half to get here! Foreign Man chuckles pathetically. The crowd HOWLS.  Andy's rockin'. ANDY (AS FOREIGN MAN) (cont'd) But talking about the terrible things: My wife.  Take my --
"Take my wife, please take her."

T-take my wife, please take her... The rhythm is thrown.  A couple laughs. A flustered pause.  Andy glances down, then continues. ANDY (AS FOREIGN MAN) (cont'd) No really, I am only foolink.  I love my wife very much.  But she don't know how to cook --
"Her cooking is so bad, is terrible."

H-her cooking... (Andy stumbles uncomfortably) Uh, cooking is so bad, is terrible. The laughs are weaker.  The act is getting wrecked. IN BACK - George grimaces.  Who the hell's doing this?? Angry, George hurries down front, looking for the loud je He scans the tables... and it's Zmuda. ANDY (AS FOREIGN MAN) (cont'd) But right now --

"But right now I would like to do for you some imitations.  First, the Archie Bunker." Andy freezes up. The audience is embarrassed. A frazzled confusion, then Andy drops the accent.  He gla at Zmuda.
Sir, do you have a problem?
Yeah, my problem is you're tired. Andy winces.
I, I was asked to do this material -
Sure, because your new stuff's a bunch of crap.  Kaufman, people are sick of you.  The wrestling... the hoaxes...
(defensive) Hey -- that stuff gets written-up in the papers --
Who gives a shit?!  It's not funny! GEORGE - is dumbfounded.
(to himself) Why...?  Andy, why...?
I used to think you were original.
I was very original!

Yeah, exactly -- "was"!  But now, you're creatively bankrupt. (he gleams cruelly) In fact, Ladies and Gentlemen, Kaufman's so desperate, he PAID me to do this tonight!!  I'm a plant. It's just a fresh coat of paint on an old broken-down routine. (back to Andy) Isn't that true??? Andy shudders. The audience averts their eyes. A painful silence. "Andy Kaufman" has been destroyed.
Andy and George walk sadly down the street.  There is a horrible gloom over them.
The world thinks Andy Kaufman sucks. So I was just giving 'em what they want...

(sadly) Andy, they don't think you suck. They've just... lost a reason to love you. The guys stop walking.  George gently speaks. GEORGE (cont'd) You've gotta make the public embrace you again.  You have to win back their sympathy...
He nods.
I'll come up with something.
The telephone wakes up Lynne in the new bedroom.  She loo over -- Andy's not there.  She looks at the clock and it' 4:30 am.  She picks up the phone.
Andy!!... Where are you?  I've been worried sick... NOW??... Where do you want to meet?... Okay, I'll call them... Lynne's baffled.
Late-night Hollywood weirdos mill about.  Andy sits with bleary Lynne, Zmuda, and George.  Zmuda admires the menu.
Look at that Grand Slam!  Two eggs, two bacon, two sausage, two pancakes -- $2.99!  How do they do it?
They get you on the coffee.
(irritable) Excuse me -- but could Andy tell us why we're here??? All heads turn.  A long pause. Then -- Andy stiffly speaks.
I have cancer. Beat.  Zmuda nods.
Hey, that's good!  We can make that play. (spitballing) And we'll really drag it out.  You get better, you get worse... you die...
FORGET IT.  It's in terrible taste! I want nothing to do with this. Pause.  Lynne is puzzled.
Andy, are you serious?
(grinning) Serious like a heart attack!  Hey, maybe I can push you around in some goofy wheelchair! Andy softly shakes his head.
No, it's true.  I have lung cancer.
That's ridiculous.  You don't even smoke.
(emphatic) I -- I got some freaky rare kind. It's called large-celled carcinoma. Lynne's eyes tear up.  She hugs onto Andy.
Jesus, Andy!  Can they cure it?
They don't know... they've gotta run more tests.
(starting to cry) Have you told your family?
No, NO!  Not yet.  I feel bad -- I've jerked 'em around so many times. George and Zmuda glance skeptically at each other.  Hmm.. Confused, George leans in to Andy.
Andy... you look me in the eye, and tell me this is true. Andy gulps.
George -- it's true.
George confronts Zmuda.
If I find out you're behind this, I'll kill you.
What are ya TALKIN' ABOUT?!  I was the one saying I didn't believe it!
Exactly.  That's the sort of thing you guys would work out to fuck me up.

Andy is doing laundry.  He empties the clean clothes, put them in a basket, and carries them to the rug.  Then he s down and starts laying out pairs of socks in highly symmetrical patterns.  Focused, impassive, Andy pointless orders the socks like the world depended on it. Lynne enters, emotionally wrecked.  She stares in frustration at Andy's behavior.
How can you be so casual??!
(he shrugs) Even if I'm dying -- I still need clean socks.
You're NOT DYING!
Okay.  You're probably right. He keeps working.  Lynne loses it.

God, you're so detached!! Lynne storms out. Andy finishes his socks.  Satisfied... he turns on the TV ON THE TV: It's "Lassie."  Little TIMMY is laid-up in bed with a broken leg.  Suddenly LASSIE runs in, holding a bo Lassie places the book on his lap.  The boy smiles gratefully.

Thank you, girl.  You're my best friend. Timmy warmly embraces the dog. ANDY - is terribly touched.  Tears start rolling down his face. Genuine sobbing.  Terrible grief, until he wipes his chee Andy collects himself, then reaches for a phone.  He dial long number.
(on phone) Dad...?
ANDY lies under the machine.  It bombards his body with powerful radiation.
The whole Kaufman family is gathered.  Stanley, Janice, Michael and Carol listen to a BLAND DOCTOR in a white coa

The cancer started in Andy's left arm and spread to his lungs.  We've initiated an aggressive radiation program... see if we can eradicate the affected cells. (his BEEPER goes off) Excuse me.  I'll be right back. The doctor leaves.  A somber silence -- and then Janice bursts into tears.  Stanley hugs her tightly. Carol watches the doctor with great hostility.  His old tennis shoes are grabbing her attention.  He leaves, and frowns.
What a crock.
(angered) How dare you make light of this!
Dad, I cried when he broke his neck. He's not gettin' me again --
(impassioned) Jesus!  He's got lung cancer! A standoff moment.  Carol loses it.

See, that's exactly it!  He picked lung cancer, because he doesn't smoke.  That makes it weird!  If he'd picked leukemia, it'd be totally believable, and we'd all be going, "Poor Andy, he's really sick."  So he chose lung cancer, because he WANTS us to be scratching our heads, saying, "Is this real?"
(trying to convince herself) Of course it's real.  We're in a hospital...
Mom, it's Cedars-Sinai!  It's a showbiz hospital!  Andy's studio friends probably run this place!
He plans these things out.  He takes over, hires actors... (beat) Personally, I didn't think that "doctor" was very convincing.
Did you notice his costume had the wrong shoes?
(excited) Yeah!  He didn't have doctor shoes! A moment of total silence.  All four of them look at each other.  Is there... a glimmer of hope?
We all know he's talked about faking his own death...
Sure -- but what if he isn't? (sad; poignant) My son could be dying... and we're actin' like we're on Candid Camera.
George pulls up in his convertible.  He jumps out. He walks to the door and starts to knock -- when suddenly creeps open.  It's Lynne, putting her finger to her lips: Shh!
The house is dark.  Lynne leads George into the shrouded living room... and Andy is sitting in a Lotus position, concentrating.  In front is a WILD-HAIRED MAN in a purple robe.
I want you to visualize.  Visualize big, healthy white cells in your body.  Now visualize little cancer cells.  Now those big white cells are attacking the cancer cells...
I see them... I see the white cells... In the corner -- George stares.  He's fighting his skepticism.
The drapes are open.  Sunlight streams in.  Andy hugs the teacher goodbye, and the man leaves. George has been waiting in back.
What was that all about?
It's visualization therapy.  He's helping me turn inward and fight the disease. Long beat.
He's an actor.  I remember him in "The In-Laws." Ah.  Andy's eyes widen.  His wheels are spinning fast.

Uh, yes... that's true.  But he's also ordained in holistic medicine. ON GEORGE - He glares, stewing.  George is fed up. ON ANDY - An unspoken tension.  Then suddenly, he breaks down. ANDY (cont'd) George, what am I supposed to do?! I'm sick, and I'm tryin' to get better... but everyone's lookin' at me funny!  Even you come to my home and act like I'm puttin' on a skit!
You must take a little pleasure in it.
Of course! (beat) But that doesn't mean I don't need everyone's support!  I can't be surrounded by negative energy. George shakes his head.
Andy, you're surrounded by what you create.  You are the KING of negative energy.

(thrown) Y-yeah?  Well, then it has to stop! Because if these bad vibes get out... then everyone will be talkin' about how sick I am, and it becomes a self-fulfilling prophecy, and then -- I'm dead. Andy struggles to remain composed.  George sighs.
So how can I help you...?
I wanna go back to work and put on a happy show. (bright-eyed) The best show anybody's ever seen!
Do you wanna tour the clubs?
No clubs.  I wanna reach the TOP! (beat) Carnegie Hall...! George gently smiles.
A STAFF meeting at the National Enquirer.
I'm working on a great cover story: I've got a guy in the lab at Cedars. He says Andy Kaufman is dying of lung cancer. Beat.  The room GROANS.
What bullshit!  No.  No more Kaufman stories!  He's burned us too many times!
Yeah, he's definitely not dying. He's playing Carnegie Hall next month! The Reporter frowns.
Jesus.  Only Kaufman would use cancer as a publicity stunt.
A 16mm PROJECTOR runs a scratchy 1930's movie short on th wall.  Smiling fake COWBOYS and COWGIRLS dance, the cowgi straddling hobby horses.  They all SING.
"I've got spurs That jingle-jangle jingle..."
Andy, George and Zmuda watch.  Andy's face is enthralled like a kid.
This is great.  The crowd's gonna love this! (giddy; thinking) Hey... do you still think any of those cowgirls are still alive?
I dunno.  If they were, they'd be pushin' 80.

Well, call SAG.  It'd be cool to get one on the show. (excited) I want the evening to build and build.  It's gonna have the most incredible ending: Singers, dancers, the "Hallelujah Chorus" -- then the sky opens, and Santa Claus comes flying down!
And you say, "Santa, what am I gettin' for Christmas?"  And he says, "Cancer!"
No!  NO NO NO!  None of that!  I want this show to be positive!
That's great... but this show's gonna cost a fortune.  Even if it sells out, you'll still lose eighty grand. Andy smiles.
I don't care about the money.  I just want the show to deliver.
So who's gonna pay for it?
Tony Clifton.
(beat) You know Tony doesn't have that kind of money.
Then he'll borrow it.  I know Tony better than you do.  Even if he has to work another ten years to pay it off, he'll do it! Pause.  George considers this -- then slowly nods.
Okay, Andy.  Will do.
Andy silently sits.  The doctor and two NURSES administer chemo drip into Andy's body. He stares at the needle in his arm. The chemo begins.
A dressy NEW YORK CROWD pushes into Carnegie Hall.  The marquee says "ANDY KAUFMAN."
The show is on.  Andy effusively PLAYS his conga drum and SINGS nonsense words to "Allouette, Gentille Alloutte."
Abbu daba, abi abbu daba!  Abbu daba, abu dabu do! (to the crowd) Abbu dabbu da ba do...! Everyone repeats.  In the audience, George sings along to
A ba du ba ti la ma na go!

head_text.subj: A BA DU BA TI... LA... MA NA GO...

text: (grinning) Abbu da ba du ba ti lama na gobo abi tabu la!
The crowd hopelessly breaks out LAUGHING. ANDY laughs along.  They're all having a good time.
The corny "Jingle Jangle Cowboy" MOVIE is playing on a bi screen.  It finishes.  Beaming Andy grabs the mike.

Ladies and Gentlemen!  I'm pleased to announce that we have with us the one surviving cowgirl from that 1931 film, Eleanor "Cody" Gould!! Crazed APPLAUSE.  Frail ELEANOR GOULD, 75, comes onstage. ANDY (cont'd) It's such an honor to have you here.
(squinting into the lights) Andy... this is so overwhelming...

Well, it's gettin' even better! 'Cause we found one of the original hobby horses!  Do you -- do you think you could treat us to a few steps from "Jingle Jangle Jingle"? Eleanor starts to protest -- but Andy hands her the HOBBY HORSE.  She blushes.  Andy turns away, goes to the band, starts conducting.  They begin to PLAY "JINGLE JANGLE JINGLE."  Eleanor awkwardly starts dancing in circles. Andy gets excited and conducts FASTER.  Eleanor is sweati She dances faster. Andy impatiently SPEEDS UP the MUSIC MORE.  Eleanor desperately skips in circles, trying to keep up... when suddenly she grabs her heart. Eleanor stops -- and collapses.  She's down. A horrified GASP from the crowd.  The band stops playing. CREW MEMBERS run on from backstage.  One checks her heart She's not moving.  Zmuda runs out, horrified.

Is there a doctor in the house??! The crowd is stunned silent.  Pause -- then one man stand It's Michael. Straight-faced, he hurries out of his seat, sprints down aisle, and goes on stage.  Michael checks her pulse and loosens her blouse.  He presses Eleanor's chest, trying t restart her heart.  But then -- he shakes his head sadly. She's dead. The crowd MOANS sadly.  Michael covers Eleanor with a jacket.
Andy watches, pleased.  Suddenly, he COUGHS harshly.  And drinks some water.  Pause... then he puts on a goofy Indi headdress and runs back out.

Eleanor lies dead.  Andy skips over and starts doing an Indian war dance around her body.  The crowd is baffled. Andy WHOOPS, he CHANTS... and then Eleanor starts to rise He WHOOPS triumphantly.  She lives, like Frankenstein reborn!  The crowd CHEERS, surprised and giggling.
Ladies and Gentlemen, she's alive! Huge APPLAUSE.

Ladies and Gentlemen, the Mormon Tabernacle Choir!!! Rear curtains part, and the MORMON TABERNACLE CHOIR belts out the "Hallelujah Chorus"! It's spectacular.  The crowd goes nuts. ANDY (cont'd) Oh my gosh, it's the Rockettes! Yes indeed, TWO DOZEN ROCKETTES rush in from the sides, l kicking high. The crowd WHOOS. ANDY (cont'd) Girls and Boys, it's Santa Claus!! Snow start falling, and SANTA ON HIS SLEIGH drops from above. The crowd screams with excitement.  It's unbelievable.  T leap to a standing ovation. In front are Stanley and Janice.  They start crying. Beaming Andy embraces Eleanor.  Then he takes the mike. ANDY (cont'd) And it's not over yet!!  'Cause I'm taking you all out to Milk and Cookies!! The crowd laughs. ANDY (cont'd) I'm serious!!!!!!!
A thousand people file out -- and THIRTY-FIVE SCHOOLBUSES are parked up and down Fifth Avenue!!!  The crowd is AWED Andy euphorically marches out, pushing his endurance.  He the Pied Piper.
Single file!  Don't rush!  There's enough cookies for everyone!!
The schoolbuses pull up to a school.  The disoriented passengers step out, not sure what to expect...

The audience crowds inside... and LADY CAFETERIA WORKERS hairnets are dispensing milk and cookies.  It's remarkabl At a little kids table sit Andy and Lynne.  Andy's face i pure joy.  He watches all the adults munching on their cookies, everyone giddy at the silliness of it all. Andy smiles beautifully.  He squeezes Lynne's hand, then whispers.
I don't want this to ever end...
A stucco SPA RESORT sits in the middle of the rocky deser
A room with soft lighting and billowing curtains.  A New HEALER is laying crystals upon Andy's body. Andy COUGHS.  His hat is off, revealing he's bald.
Now we'll place a blue crystal. Very high vibrations.  It's wonderful for it's healing powers.
(spellbound) Okay.  Let's try two of those... and one of the pink ones.
Zmuda stands with a swarmy ADMINISTRATOR.
Your friend is doing four crystal sessions a day, but it's just not helping.
I know... (beat) The cancer's terminal.
Yes.  That wasn't made particularly clear to us when he checked in...
(irked) Look, personally, I think rubbing rocks on people is a load of horseshit.  But if it makes Andy happy, that's all that matters. The man purses his lips.
I'm sorry to sound crass -- but we don't want to be "that health resort in New Mexico where Andy Kaufman died." (beat) I'm going to have to ask you to leave. Zmuda is speechless.
Zmuda angrily packs Andy's bags.  Zmuda is seething. But Andy is strangely calm and unaffected.
It's okay, Bob.  It wasn't really working. (a gentle smile) We'll find something better.
Lynne and Little Wendy are cooking Andy lunch.  Lynne mas up strange unidentifiable plant products.
What is this stuff?
It's all macrobiotic.  Millet, burdock root, kelp... Andy says it'll purify him. Suddenly -- a SHARP VOICE.

What is that crap?  Looks like somethin' my dog would puke up!! The women turn.  It's Andy -- dressed as Tony Clifton. A spooked moment. Tony's wig, peach tux, and sunglasses are there... but An is barely strong enough to bark out the attitude.
How 'bout me and you dolls go get some REAL food:  French fries and a Porterhouse steak!
(not sure what to say) ...Andy...? Little Wendy's eyes pop:  Oh no she broke the rule!  Tony gets very indignant.

I ain't Andy!  I'm Tony!  Andy's sick -- pick, chick, kick, lick! The doctor says he's a goner. (rousing himself) But Tony's built like a mule!  Andy asked me to be his pallbearer!  I'll do it for him!  I'm getting stronger and stronger!  Here, watch this! Tony picks up a CHAIR and starts lifting it:  Up, down, u down.  Worried, the women rush to stop him.  They take th chair.
Stop it!  C'mon, put that down.

Yeah, you're right.  We better get movin'.  We don't wanna miss Happy Hour at Kelbos -- all the Mai Tai's you can drink for $4.99. Tony jauntily turns to exit.  He gestures to the ladies. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd) Let's go! (he starts SINGING "New York, New York") "These vagabond blues, Are washin' away. I'll make a brand new start of it..." Tony reaches the doorway -- and collapses. He clutches himself in pain.
Andy!! Shocked, they run over. Tony lies huddled on the ground.  He mutters sadly, defeatedly.
Dammit...
The sun is setting, purple and orange over the hills.  An and George lie on chaise lounges, serenely staring out. Andy has a blank look on his face, and has lost more weig He is a shadow of himself.
I can't move my arm.
(awkwardly) You've got good days and bad days. Andy softly sighs.
My hair is coming out.
(whispers) Yeah... George silently pats Andy.  Andy's energy is sapped, but forces himself to be upbeat.

I've got an idea for a new TV show for me to star in.  It's called "Uncle Andy's Fun House" -- it'll be a Saturday morning thing where I can goof off with the kids.  You know, puppets, magic tricks... George is choked up.  He goes along with it.
(long pause) I think we can sell that. Silence. George struggles not to shatter Andy's enthusiasm. Andy smiles gratefully.
Hey... thanks for always backin' me. George clenches Andy's hand.
Did your -- doctor say it's okay for you to go back to work?
Ehhh, you know those guys.  If he had his way, I'd be stuck in the hospital, running tests all day. (beat) And anyway, I've found a new guy who's gonna be able to instantly remove the cancer.
(startled) Really?
Yeah!  He's a psychic surgeon in the Philippines, and he's amazing!  He rubs you and sucks the disease right out! Andy beams.  George stares sadly.
The Philippines?  I dunno... Andy... he sounds like one of your characters.
His voice gets hushed.
No... this guy's special. (very sincere) He performs miracles. George doesn't know how to respond. Andy looks up pleadingly. ANDY (cont'd) He's my last chance.
Baguio, a tiny scratched-in-the-dirt Philippine city. Suddenly, a rattletrap COMMUTER PLANE lurches out of the sky.  It hits a dirt runway.  Dust flies.  Chickens squaw and run.
Andy, Lynne, and Zmuda ride through the impoverished city Andy stares in amazement.
They reach a brick building.  A sign says "CLINIC," with eye over a triangle.
A NURSE hurriedly helps weakened Andy sign a bunch of for Money is handed over. Andy's clothes are stripped off.  They're thrown in a locker.

A large white tiled room.  Lynne and Zmuda roll in pallid Andy, his limp body unmoving. Andy looks up... and there's a LONG LINE OF SICKLY PEOPLE Primarily Japanese, emaciated, all stripped to their underwear and barely able to stand. They have a look of desperation and reverence. At the head of the line is JUN ROXAS at his work station: bench, a sink, and ATTENDANTS with clean towels. A SICKLY WOMAN crawls onto the bench.  Jun impassively presses his hand into the fatty flesh of her stomach, kneading, searching.  Pause, then he removes some BLOODY GUTS. He flings them into a bucket. The woman cries out. Andy gasps. The woman is helped away. Jun turns to wash his hands.  An attendant gives him a to to dry with.  Then a SICKLY MAN crawls up... Andy rolls closer.  He stares at all this with fear. Nervousness.  Hope. Jun impassively presses his hand against the man's head. concentrates, searching... then pulls out some BLOODY GUT He flings them into a bucket. The man shakes.  He is helped away. Andy is wide-eyed.  He gets closer... closer... More patients.  More bloody guts.  More sobbing. Andy's excitement builds. Then -- he reaches the front. A moment. Lynne and Zmuda stare into Andy's eyes, drawn in by his total belief.  They are overcome.  It feels like they're saying goodbye.  Lynne gives Andy a tender kiss.  Zmuda starts to shake his hand -- and instead hugs him tightly. Andy smiles, then the attendants lift him from the wheelchair.  They help him up to the bench. Andy lies down.  Fluorescent lights buzz overhead. He looks over, and Jun Roxas is washing his hands from th previous patient. Andy shivers, anticipating the miracle. Jun turns.  An attendant gives him a towel to dry off. Andy relaxes, readying for it all... He glances at Jun's hands.  Jun hands back the towel -- a under it the attendant quickly slips Jun a sack of animal intestines. Jun discreetly palms it.  He's a fake.

A moment of stunned disbelief. He is shocked.  Outraged.  Disappointed.  Flabbergasted. The faith is meaningless.  The joke is cosmic.  The con m has been conned. Andy's overpowering emotions coalesce... and he starts to LAUGH. It's sidesplittingly funny.  Andy LAUGHS, and LAUGHS, and LAUGHS, like a crazy man with no salvation, the joy releasing him, the tears rolling down his cheeks. His face flushes with color.  Life sparkles in his eyes. Andy laughs and guffaws until he's hoarse.  This is the b gag of them all.

Andy lies in peace in a casket.  He has died. His expression is pleasantly bland.  Almost Latka-like. his face is caked with so much funeral-home makeup, it almost looks like a mask. We slowly widen.  The casket is surrounded by beautiful flowers.  We TILT UP... and high above... is a MOVIE SCRE On the SCREEN is a projection of Andy, silently staring a us.  There's a gentle smile on his face.  It's the image from the opening of this film. ANDY'S POV: The chapel is filled with GRIEVING MOURNERS. All are in black.  Everyone's quiet, in a state of shock. Andy's family is huddled. Lynne sits alone in a pew, crying. George gives Zmuda a hug.  Little Wendy comes over... and they comfort each other. Everyone who ever knew Andy is there: Taxi cast, Fridays cast, TM followers, hookers, Jerry Lawler, Ed Weinberger, Maynard Smith, Budd Friedman, it goes on and on... And -- they all have odd discombobulated expressions.  Th stare up at the PROJECTED ANDY.

Well... My show is over.  I did my best, and I just want to say, until we meet again... please remember: (he begins to SING) "In this friendly, friendly world... With each day so full of joy. Why should any heart be lonely." Some gathered people tentatively join in the SINGING. ANDY (ON FILM) (cont'd) So everybody!  Put your arm around the person next to you, even if you don't like that person.  Come on! (he resumes SINGING) "The world is such a wonderful place, To wander through, When you've got someone to love, To wander along with you. With the sky so full of stars, And the river so full of songs, Every heart should be so thankful, Thankful for this friendly, friendly world..." The curtain behind the coffin OPENS and the casket with Andy's body slowly slides into the DARKNESS. The curtain closes.  The FILM ENDS. And all goes silent. Some people cry.  Some begin to leave.  Most of them are just staying, numbed. George and Zmuda whisper.
It's a perfect Kaufman audience.
Yeah.  They don't know whether to be sad, or angry. The Taxi cast are flustered.
Why are people leaving?  The curtain's gonna open.  Andy's gonna come out... I know it!
Sure, the body was just made of wax...! (a very long beat) Wasn't it......? Silence.  They look to the front. The closed curtain wafts... then settles motionless.

A SUPER slowly appears:  "EXACTLY ONE YEAR LATER" On Sunset, TWO DUDES come riding along on skateboards. Suddenly they reach -- INSANITY.  Traffic on Sunset is jammed.  HONKING limousines jockey to squeeze by. Confused, one Dude squints into the distance -- and his e pop.
Oh my GOD. (stupefied) That's the freakiest thing I've ever seen!!  Look! He points.  His friend turns -- and gasps. AT THE COMEDY STORE - The marquee says "TONY CLIFTON: LIV
Man, we were right!  He's not dead!
He's just been lyin' low for a year!
Hysterical, the guys race up to the club.  But outside, there's a CRAZED, PULSING MOB.  People are screaming. Police have barricades.  Everybody cries to get in.

It's packed.  Every square inch is filled with glittery Hollywood VIPs.  People make chit-chat... but there is a squeamish excitement in the air.  A brooding unease.  Nob knows what to expect. Suddenly -- the lights go black.  A BOOMING ANNOUNCER.
Ladies and Gentlemen!  Please put your hands together for... Tony Clifton! The THEME FROM 2001 starts playing.  "DAAAAA, DAAAAA,

A small SPOT appears -- on a peach tuxedo.  The light gro bigger, bigger... the tension magnifying... people gasping... our view widening... until Tony Clifton is revealed onstage! It's an extraordinary theatrical moment -- without respon The crowd has no idea what to do. Tony smirks.

How ya doin'? Dead silence. Tony struts downstage.  He waves to the crowd. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd) How you doin' back there?! (to the front rows) How you doin' up here?! Still no response.  Until -- a lone reckless VOICE.
Andy! Whoa.  The crowd rustles nervously. Tony grimaces.

Don't know nothin' about no Andy. Just some dead guy tryin' to ride my coattails. (to the BAND) Let's HIT IT, boys!  One, two, anda one two three four! The BAND kicks in with disco anthem "I WILL SURVIVE."  To starts SINGING the schmaltzy opening: TONY CLIFTON (cont'd) "First I was afraid I was petrified. Kept thinkin' I could never live Without you at my side." (he wipes away a pretend tear) "Were you the one that tried to Hurt me with goodbye? Did you think I'd crumble? Did you think I'd lay down and Die...?" We PAN the room full of enthralled spectators.  At a fron table are George and Lynne. Tony attacks the chorus. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd) "Oh no not I!

As long as I know how to love, I know I'll simply stay alive!" In the crowd, we pass face after face -- smiling... frowning... intrigued... confused... until we settle on a man in the very last row. Bob Zmuda. Enjoying the show more than anyone. TONY CLIFTON (cont'd) "I've got all my life to live I've got all my life to give. I will survive..." (he hits his big finish)
The music CRESCENDOS, and the song ENDS. Zmuda grins and APPLAUDS proudly.
